citation.article-title: Campylobacter pylori subsp. mustelae subsp. nov. isolated from the gastric mucosa of ferrets, Mustela putorius furo, and an emended description of Campylobacter pylori.

p.s: Description of Campylobucter pylori subsp. mustelae subsp. nov.
Campylobucter pylori subsp. mustelae (mus. tel'ae. L. gen. n. mustelae, of a ferret)
Lateral as well as polar flagella (3; Fox et al., IV Int Campylobacter Workshop).
Susceptible to nalidixic acid and resistant to cephalothin.
Does not exhibit leucine arylanidase activity in enzyme profiles (Tompkins et al., Abstr.
Isolated from the gastric mucosa of ferrets.
The type strain is strain R85-13-6 (= ATCC 43772); it has a G+C content of 38 mol%.
Characteristics of type strain R85-13-6 are given in Table 1.
